徐世昌.definition: Xu Shichang (1855-1939), politician associated with the Northern Warlords, president of China in 1921

徐俊.definition: Xu Jun (1962-), Chinese Chinese chess grandmaster

徐光啟.definition: Xu Guangqi (1562-1633), agricultural scientist, astronomer, and mathematician in the Ming dynasty

徐克.definition: Tsui Hark (1951-), Chinese movie director and producer

徐匡迪.definition: Xu Kuangdi (1937-), PRC politician and former mayor of Shanghai

徐娘半老.definition: middle-aged but still attractive woman; lady of a certain age

徐家匯.definition: Xujiahui, an area in 徐匯區|徐汇区[Xu2 hui4 qu1], Xuhui district, central Shanghai

徐州市.definition: Xuzhou, prefecture-level city in Jiangsu Province 江蘇省|江苏省[Jiang1su1 Sheng3]

徐悲鴻.definition: Xu Beihong (1895-1953), famous European-trained painter and influential art teacher

徐星.definition: Xu Xing (1969-), Chinese palaeontologist; Xu Xing (1956-), Chinese short story writer

徐渭.definition: Xu Wei (1521-1593), Ming dynasty Chinese painter and author

徐熙媛.definition: Barbie Hsu (1976-2025), Taiwanese entertainer, nicknamed 大S

徐禎卿.definition: Xu Zhenqing (1479-1511), Ming writer, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子

徐福.definition: Xu Fu (3rd century BC), Qin dynasty court necromancer

徐緩.definition: slow; sluggish; lazily; to slow down

徐聞.definition: Xuwen county in Zhanjiang 湛江[Zhan4 jiang1], Guangdong

徐聞縣.definition: Xuwen county in Zhanjiang 湛江[Zhan4 jiang1], Guangdong

徐鉉.definition: Xu Xuan (-991), author of commentaries on Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字註|说文解字注[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4 Zhu4]

徐霞客.definition: Xu Xiake (1587-1641), Ming dynasty travel writer and geographer, author of Xu Xiake's Travel Diaries 徐霞客遊記|徐霞客游记[Xu2 Xia2 ke4 You2 ji4]

徐霞客遊記.definition: Xu Xiake's Travel Diaries, a book of travel records by 徐霞客[Xu2 Xia2 ke4] on geology, geography, plants etc
